name: Japanese badger
description: The Japanese badger is a species of carnivoran of the family Mustelidae, the weasels and their kin. Endemic to Japan, it is found on Honshu, Kyushu, Shikoku, and Sh≈çdoshima. It is assigned to the genus Meles with its close relatives, the European, Caucasian and Asian badgers. In Japan, it is called by the name anaguma meaning "hole-bear", or mujina.
